intro: Senecio mulgediifolius, commonly known as the mulgediifolius groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, typical of the daisy family. Senecio mulgediifolius is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
